item.title: Amendments
item.description:
PlainSight Lab does not treat governance as content. Governing documents are binding.

This page defines how changes occur to binding documents and how those changes are recorded.

If it is not amended through process, it is not changed.

1. What Can Be Amended

Amendments apply to documents that are designated:

  • Active in Docs, and/or
  • identified as canonical sources of truth (constitution, thesis, governance framework, policies)

Draft documents may be edited freely until they become Active.

item.title: Authority Model
item.description:
Authority Model

Authority within PlainSight Lab is defined, bounded, and attributable.

Authority does not arise from personality, reputation, expertise, or influence.
Authority arises only from constitutional definition and documented role.

If authority is not explicitly granted, it does not exist.

Authority Types

PlainSight Lab recognizes three authority types:

1. Epistemic Authority

The authority to define canonical truth.

This includes:

  • Specification definition
  • Invariant articulation
  • Problem classification
  • Formal correction criteria

Epistemic authority is constrained by the Constitution and subject to amendment thresholds.

item.title: Decision Records
item.description:
Governance requires memory.

This page defines what must be recorded, how records are structured, and where authoritative decision history lives.

If a decision is binding, it must be recorded.
If it is not recorded, it is not binding.

1. What Gets Recorded

Record a Decision Record when:

  • a governing document is adopted, amended, or retired
  • a steward role is created, assigned, or revoked
  • an exception is granted (and its expiry)
  • a compliance or enforcement action is taken
  • an authority boundary is clarified in a binding way

item.title: Stewards
item.description:
Stewards

Stewardship roles within PlainSight Lab are constitutional offices.

They exist to carry bounded authority in service of invariant preservation, correction discipline, and harm containment.

Stewardship is not ownership.
It is not branding.
It is not executive status.

It is accountable authority exercised within clearly defined limits.

Stewardship is a constitutional burden, not a title.
